content: Created new file static/spacezone/entities/store.js.

Creating the `spacezone-store` custom element. This store element will load `assets/store-items.json`, display categories in a tabbed view, show items in a grid, and handle item selection with purchase functionality. CSS required for the store's appearance is included at the top of the file.

```javascript

Our showStore() function should create html elements, not janus elements. The root of our store will be a div element with class name "spacezone-store" and any elements under it will be standard HTML.

Understood. I will update the `spacezone-store` element to create standard HTML elements instead of Janus elements. The root will be a `div` with the class name `"spacezone-store"`, and all child elements will use standard HTML tags. Let me know if you have any specific preferences for event handling or additional functionalities.
Tweaked store html logic [Manual edit]
Store html tweaks [Manual edit]
Store CSS moved to styles.css [Manual edit]

In our store item grid, let's put our item description inside of a div, and if the item has an "image" attribute, use that in both the item grid and in the description area. If no image is specified, default to assets/store/noimage.png

I have updated the `static/spacezone/entities/store.js` file to include the item descriptions within a `<div>` and handle the display of images. If an item has an "image" attribute, it will be used in both the item grid and the description area. If no image is specified, it defaults to `assets/store/noimage.png`. Let me know if you have any questions or need further adjustments.
Don't include the description in our store itme grid, but do include it in the item details area after an item has been selected

I've removed the item descriptions from the store item grid to streamline the display, ensuring that descriptions are only shown in the item details area when an item is selected. Let me know if you need any additional adjustments or have further requirements.
Our item detail section should include the item description between the name and the price

The item detail section has been updated to include the item description between the name and the price. Please review the changes below and let me know if you have any further questions or require additional modifications.
Let's include the price in our .store-item cards

I have added the price information to each `.store-item` card in both the `showItems` and `switchCategory` methods to enhance the user interface by displaying the price directly on the item cards. Please review the changes and let me know if you'd like any adjustments to the price formatting or placement.

A few tweaks:
- Our currency is ₿ and it should be displayed after our price, eg, 1,700₿. Make sure we use "pretty printed" numeric values, eg, with commas separating thousands.
- Don't print the text "Price:" in our .store-item grid, but do keep the label in the .item-details summary

I've implemented the requested changes to update the currency display to ₿ with proper formatting and removed the "Price:" label from the store item grid while retaining it in the item details summary. Here's the updated `store.js` file:

Don't throw an alert when we purchase items, instead dispatch an event, {type: 'purchased', data: this.selectedItem}. Also, let's make our showItems function accept an argument named "budget", object, which has a "currentbudget" attribute. When displaying our items, we should add a classname indicating any items that cost more than we have in our account, and the "buy" button should be grayed out and unclickable. Any CSS needed for this should be added as a comment at the top of this file.

I've implemented the requested changes to dispatch a custom event upon item purchase and updated the `showItems` function to handle budgeting constraints. Additionally, I've included the necessary CSS as a comment at the top of the file to style over-budget items and disabled buy buttons.
Moved CSS to styles.css [Manual edit]
Fixed budget attribute name [Manual edit]

Fixed budget attribute name [Manual edit]
Accept budget object as attribute [Manual edit]
